lines.text: Bad luck either makes a man or destroys him. Are you gonna let it destroy you? Depending how you take it, bad luck can be a big break.
He'll rob again. Once does not a habit make, but the second time, a stray becomes a rabid dog. Am I wrong?
They say there's no such thing as a bad man. Only bad situations...
On the bus, the air was so thick, he felt woozy. A wailing infant shook with tears and the woman beside him reeked with the stink of cheap perfume.
Sounds fishy to me. We got some famous light-fingered ladies, too.
Get me her record.
No need. I know her down to the moles on her back.
Hey, long time no see.
Oh, it's you, Ichikawa-san. I figured you'd kicked the bucket.

[laughs]
That's a helluva welcome.
You know this guy, don't you?
Who knows? At my age, I've stopped noticing handsome young men.
You're slippery as the eels on the menu here.
Help him out. The guy's just a greenhorn. Listen, mess with a rookie and you'll be sorry later.
I don't know. You're violating my civil rights.
Awfully stylish language, there.
I can do better than that.
Like what?
Bye-bye.
Look, how pretty that is. In the last 20 years, I've completely forgotten how wonderful the stars are.
00. Talk to the bitch with the white flower.
Where's he hang out, then?
I don't know. I've heard he's keen on baseball. I bet he goes to the stadium.
How 'bout some ice pops? Sweet popsicles. Popsicles here.
We'll take two.
Twenty yen, please.
Now, the hard part.
I'll get him.
Don't you see anything but Honda? We can't put this crowd at risk. We have to assume he's armed. And a bullet's nothing like a foul ball. Got to get him away from the crowd.
But how?
We mull it over. We've got five innings to go.
That kind of high-strung girl is as stubborn as they come. Make 'em mad and they clam right up.
You have to feel sorry for Yusa.

Oh, no. Thinking like that won't get you anywhere as a cop. It's easy to develop delusions, chasing criminals all day. We can't forget the many sheep a lone wolf leaves wounded. Half those citations were capital cases. There's no help for a cop who doesn't believe he's protecting the masses. I say leave the psychoanalysis to the detective novels.
You never know what life has in store.
See, it's that house with the crape myrtle bush. Crape myrtle always brings bad luck.
It's really a problem. Was it you who moved the body?
I was her doctor and she didn't even like me to see her naked flesh. I'm sure she wouldn't have wanted anyone to see her that way.
Sato-san, do you think it was my Colt again?
What the hell does it matter if it was?
The way I imagine it...
Imagining only complicates an investigation. Stick to the facts.

This is the make-or-break point. He's killed someone. A killer's like a mad dog. Do you know how a mad dog walks? There's an old ditty that's disturbingly close to home. "A mad dog only sees straight paths."
Harumi's out today. She's a real problem, that one. One little comment and she takes the day off. She's quiet all right, but the quiet ones are always the most stubborn. And she's sick right now.
She's sick?
With her monthlies, you know. They're always impossible then.
Harumi, you must tell them everything you know.
I don't know what I don't know.
Who is he anyway?
A mad dog.
Enjoy.
It's sake.
It's one way to beat the heat.
Thanks. What'd he do?
He came late at night and left ridiculously early the next morning. Beyond that...
Who was his geisha?
Oh, that's right. Yes, she escorted him as far as the street.
Her name?
Kintaro. She's one of Wakehisamatsu's girls.
